                        <h1 class="article__title">Web3 is an empty buzzword â€“ but beware, it can still hurt you</h1>

                                                    <p class="article__strap">There's plenty of excitement about a new, decentralised version of the internet. It is largely still a fantasy, but scammers are using it to lure in unsuspecting victims, writes <strong>Annalee Newitz</strong></p>

                        <p class="article__byline">By <span class="article__byline-author"><a href="/author/annalee-newitz/" class="author font-sans-serif-xxs--bold">Annalee Newitz</a></span></p>
                        <figure class="article-image-inline" data-method="replace-inline-image"><img data-src="https://images.newscientist.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/02132825/SEI_90062685.jpg?width=300" data-srcset="https://images.newscientist.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/02132825/SEI_90062685.jpg?width=100 100w, https://images.newscientist.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/02132825/SEI_90062685.jpg?width=200 200w, https://images.newscientist.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/02132825/SEI_90062685.jpg?width=249 249w, https://images.newscientist.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/02132825/SEI_90062685.jpg?width=300 300w, https://images.newscientist.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/02132825/SEI_90062685.jpg?width=400 400w, https://images.newscientist.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/02132825/SEI_90062685.jpg?width=500 500w, https://images.newscientist.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/02132825/SEI_90062685.jpg?width=600 600w, https://images.newscientist.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/02132825/SEI_90062685.jpg?width=700 700w, https://images.newscientist.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/02132825/SEI_90062685.jpg?width=800 800w, https://images.newscientist.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/02132825/SEI_90062685.jpg?width=778 778w" loading="lazy" class="image lazyload " sizes="(min-width: 1130px) 778px, (min-width: 1025px) calc(100vw - 352px), (min-width: 641px) calc(100vw - 30px), calc(100vw - 30px)" alt="2HK2K9K WEB 3.0 abstract sign with blockchain 3d illustration" width="1200" height="800" /><figcaption><p class="image__credit">Jong Ho Shin/Alamy</p></figcaption></figure>
<p>A FEW weeks ago, a couple named Heather Morgan and Ilya “Dutch” Lichtenstein were arrested in New York, accused of laundering $4.5 billion in stolen <a href="/definition/bitcoin/">bitcoin</a>. Dubbed the “crypto couple”, their story quickly went viral. Not only was the scale of the pair’s alleged crime mind-boggling, but it soon emerged that Morgan makes bizarre rap videos under the name Razzlekhan, which feature her dancing on Wall Street and issuing advice like “be a goat, not a sheep”.</p>
<p>This is hardly the only weird news from the often shady world of crypto. There has been plenty of hype recently about  …</p>

readabilityObject.title: Web3 is an empty buzzword â€“ but beware, it can still hurt you
readabilityObject.content:
There's plenty of excitement about a new, decentralised version of the internet. It is largely still a fantasy, but scammers are using it to lure in unsuspecting victims, writes Annalee Newitz

Technology | Columnist 2 March 2022

A FEW weeks ago, a couple named Heather Morgan and Ilya â€œDutchâ€ Lichtenstein were arrested in New York, accused of laundering $4.5 billion in stolen bitcoin. Dubbed the â€œcrypto coupleâ€, their story quickly went viral. Not only was the scale of the pairâ€™s alleged crime mind-boggling, but it soon emerged that Morgan makes bizarre rap videos under the name Razzlekhan, which feature her dancing on Wall Street and issuing advice like â€œbe a goat, not a sheepâ€.

This is hardly the only weird news from the often shady world of crypto. There has been plenty of hype recently about â€¦
